item.title: Liturgy
item.description: Welcome back everyone I hope everyone had a nice and restful reading week!üòä here‚Äôs the weekly schedule, some exciting events are happening this week can‚Äôt wait to see you allüòÜüï∫

item.title: Krispy Kreme Donut Sale
item.description: Need a sweet treat to get you through midterms? Look no further! ü§©üòã On Thursday, October 23rd, UWDC will be holding our Krispy Kreme fundraiser!! Come find us in the SLC market place by the food court and in the DC Foyer! üìçWe will be selling donuts from 10:30am - 2:30pm, so be sure to visit and support our team! üç©üíÉ We will be accepting e-transfer payments at both locations. Can‚Äôt wait to see you there! üíõüñ§

item.title: Art Installation
item.description: New art. Sweet cupcakes. No sign-up needed. Come celebrate the RADD ART installation with WiCS! Join us in celebrating the installation of art generously donated by RADD ART. Enjoy complimentary red velvet cupcakes!

item.description:
üéÉ Come join us for our first event of the term! üçÇTake a break from midterms and unwind with us at a relaxing Pumpkin Painting session!üçÅ Can‚Äôt wait to see you all there‚ÄºÔ∏èüëÄ
üóìÔ∏è Thursday, October 23rd, 2025 üïí 12pm-3pm üìç Hagey Hall CubeüéÉ

item.title: Biodiversity Conservation and Restoration Research Talk
item.description: Join us next Thursday October 23rd, 12:00 - 1:00 in EV1-136 for a research talk with Dr. Tim Alamenciak! He will share his work on conservation engagement in the Canadian prairies with Ducks Unlimited, cutting edge research into the use of LLMs for evidence synthesis in restoration and conservation ecology, and ongoing efforts to build communities of practice that bridge researchers and practitioners. Students will learn about findings that inform how we can engage more people in conservation and restoration work. Tim will also share opportunities for final-year thesis projects and a funded PhD opportunity. Hope to see you there üåø

item.title: Advancing Catalysis by Overcoming Limitations in Experimental Techniques
item.description:
MNS 10 Fall 2025 Week 7 Speaker Revealüî¨
Join us for our next session featuring Associate Professor in Chemistry Rodney Smith from the Smith Research Group!
üß™ Advancing Catalysis by Overcoming Limitations in Experimental Techniques üìÖ October 23, 2025 üìç RCH 110 ‚è∞ 1:30 ‚Äì 2:20 PM
Don‚Äôt miss this exciting talk exploring innovations in catalysis and experimental methods!

item.title: Next Meeting
item.description: Our next meeting is October 23rd in UTD-164!!! From 5:00pm to 6:30 pm, drop in to discuss local climate justice initiatives, upcoming projects and enjoy some snacks. We are so excited to see you there!

item.title: Mathematics Meets Economics
item.description:
Learn from Professor Lipnowski about how mathematics, computer science, and related fields are integrated in modern economic research, and how economic perspectives inform innovation in academia and tech.
Refreshment will be provided. Please RSVP with the link in our bio!

item.title: Dodgeball Tournament Tryouts
item.description: Calling all dodgeball lovers! The Faculty of Arts is participating in the Inter-society Dodgeball Tournament this term. If you‚Äôre interested in playing to support your Arts community, come try out on October 23rd at 5:30pm at CIF Gym 2! FORM IN BIO!!

item.title: Halloween Costume Workshop
item.description:
Hey everyone ü¶á! As Halloween approaches, we are collaborating with the repair club to invite you to this week's event, where you can work on your own costumes or repair clothing ü™°
New to sewing but still want to give it a try? No worries! We will provide guidance to people on how to sew. There will be 2 sewing machines, hot glue guns, hand tools, saws, and other trinkets to help you in your sewing process. Looking forward to seeing you there !!

item.title: Crisis Night: The Beast of Cyrus
item.description:
üê∫ CRISIS NIGHT: THE BEAST OF CYRUS üåï
The small town of Cyrus thought it was safe‚Ä¶ until Shepherd Thaddeus Grove found seven of his sheep slaughtered overnight. With winter approaching and panic spreading, the townsfolk must uncover the truth before the danger strikes again.
Join us for a thrilling night of deduction, chaos, and suspense as you take on your roles and uncover what‚Äîor who‚Äîis hunting the town of Cyrus.
üìÖ Thursday, October 23rd, 2025 üïï 6 PM ‚Äì 8 PM üìç HH 336 üçø Snacks, drinks, and a after-event social included!
üïØÔ∏è Can you survive the night?
üì≤ Sign up now - Link in our bio!

item.description:

Cette soir√©e sera une excellente occasion de laisser libre cours √† votre cr√©ativit√© et de sculpter des citrouilles effrayantes ou amusantes, tout en pratiquant votre fran√ßais. Que vous soyez d√©butant.e.s ou expert.e.s en sculpture ou en fran√ßais, tout le monde est le bienvenu !
Merci de confirmer votre pr√©sence en remplissant le formulaire dans notre bio avant mercredi √† 22h00.

item.title: Policy & Pizza
item.description:
Hey UW Young Liberals!
We‚Äôre back this Thursday, Oct 23, 7 - 9pm @ PAS 1229 for another night of good convos and even better pizza. This time, we‚Äôre tackling new topics - from Canada‚Äôs role in global affairs to AI and digital privacy, urban planning & public transport, and military and defense policy.
Whether you‚Äôre into policy debates or just here for the pizza, everyone‚Äôs welcome. DM to RSVP! üçï

item.title: All About the MCAT
item.description:
Interested in writing the MCAT? ü©∫
Back by popular demand, Wizeprep is hosting a free ‚ÄúAll About the MCAT‚Äù webinar on October 23rd!
Join expert MCAT instructors as they share proven strategies, insider tips, and insights from over a decade of experience to help you excel on your MCAT.
‚ú® Register for free through the link in our bio! #mcat #mcatprep #medschool #medicalschool #medadmissions #medschoolprep #medschoolevent #medschoolwebinar #wizeprep

item.title: Anthropology Brown Bag Talk
item.description:
We‚Äôre pleased to share details for our next Anthropology Brown Bag talk:
üé§ Speaker: Emma Brandt, University of Waterloo Communications üóì Date: Friday, October 24 üïë Time: 2:00‚Äì3:00 pm üìç Location: SILC Lab, ML 109 üìé Please see the attached publicity slide for posting and sharing.
Emma‚Äôs talk is titled ‚ÄúThe Problem of Media: Metaphors for News in Serbia‚Äù.

item.title: PHYS 10
item.description: PHYS10 is back after reading week with Dr. Jan Kycia! Learn about this year's recent Nobel Prize and all the interesting details behind the research this Friday! An introduction to superconducting devices and this year's physics Nobel Prize for exhibiting macroscopic quantum tunneling.

item.title: Bonfire Night
item.description: Nothing says fall like a bonfire night! üçÇüî• Join us for the ultimate fall night this Friday, October 25! Hot dogs, marshmallows, S‚Äômores, drinks, and chill vibes waiting for you. No RSVP- just show up and make some memories üåô‚ú® Gather around the crackling flames, enjoy hot dogs, S‚Äômores, marshmallows, and drinks; and embrace the enchanting atmosphere of a memorable night filled with laughter and camaraderie by a roaring bonfire.

item.title: Kata and Kihon - Jiujitsu
item.description:
~ Theme of the Week: Kata and Kihon
Hi everyone, this week we will be expanding on what we have learned in the last seminar by focusing on enhancing our Kata and Kihon for the week. Saturday‚Äôs class will be cancelled this week as our instructors and some of our members will be attending the Shuseikan Canada Kyu Belt seminar in Cambridge.
üóìÔ∏è FALL 2025 SCHEDULE for this week üóìÔ∏è

Town Hall is your space to share, connect, and shape your campus experience. Bring your questions, ideas, and concerns and meet the team to learn how we can support you. Can‚Äôt make it? Don‚Äôt worry! Fill out our Feedback Form in our bio!

item.title: Wontons & Dumplings Cooking Class
item.description: Join the UW Cooking Club for another fun cooking class on Saturday, October 25th! We‚Äôll be making wontons and dumplings from scratch with shrimp and pork filling! We welcome all skill levels to our lessons. Link for class sign-up can be found on our Linktree in the description! For this class, we can substitute the fillings with halal certified chicken and/or beef however we can't make it vegetarian. If you would like a substitution please contact us through instagram/discord after you purchase your ticket with your name and session number! Our classes are located at 19-105 Lexington Rd, Waterloo ON N2J 4R7 Reminders: Tie up long hair and wear closed-toed shoes. Bring a reusable container for any leftovers you might have (or if you want to bring your meals home) and don‚Äôt forget to bring water! Hope to see you there!

item.title: Outdoor Bouldering Trip
item.description: üå≤ Outdoor Bouldering Trip - Niagara GlenJoin us for a day of bouldering outdoors at one of Ontario‚Äôs most iconic spots!Thank you to @wloo.outersclub @grr_wat @orgearco and MEC Kitchener for sponsoring this event!‚ÄºÔ∏è Important Notes: -There will be a MANDATORY information session on Friday, October 24th for everyone that signs up. -Details for what time and location the information session will be held will be sent out via email to those who sign up. -If you signed up and do not attend the information session, you are forfeiting your spot on the bus without a refund.üóíÔ∏è Details:-Saturday, October 25th-Departing from X Lot at 8:00 AM-Transportation to and from the Glen is included via bus-wloocc members receive an $8 discount! (you could save $3 dollars right now)Sign up through the link in our bio, spots are limited!wloocc memberships are also available through the link in our bio!

item.description:

The clean-up starts at 10 a.m. and ends roughly at 2 p.m. To sign up, fill out the form in our discord found in our linktree. üîó We hope to see you there, Warriors! üêÑ
#uwcampuscompost #uwcc #uw #uwsustainability #volunteer

item.title: Open House
item.description: Come join our celebration of APL history at the Computer Museum Open House on Saturday, October 25, 2025! The event will be held in the Davis Centre "Fishbowl" (DC 1301), and will run from 11:00am to 4:00pm. We will have various APL-related artifacts on display, along with interactive retro computers and some of our recent acquisitions. There will be guest exhibits from the KW Computer Heritage Group as well as mathematics alumni Steve McDowell joining us at 1:30PM to talk about his experiences as one of the developers of Waterloo microAPL: The Story of Waterloo microAPL. Our Open House is free to attend, and all visitors are welcome!

item.title: Open House
item.description:
Come join our celebration of APL history at the Computer Museum Open House on Saturday, October 25, 2025!
The event will be held in the Davis Centre "Fishbowl" (DC 1301), and will run from 11:00am to 4:00pm. We will have various APL-related artifacts on display, along with interactive retro computers and some of our recent acquisitions. There will be guest exhibits from the KW Computer Heritage Group as well as mathematics alumni Steve McDowell joining us at 1:30PM to talk about his experiences as one of the developers of Waterloo microAPL: The Story of Waterloo microAPL.
Our Open House is free to attend, and all visitors are welcome!

item.title: Rage Room Rampage
item.description: Welcome back from reading week! Here are the Week 8 events!‚ú® RAGE ROOM RAMPAGEüí• üí¢ Can you feel the midterm stress building up? Release that angst at the Post-Midterm Rage Room Rampage! Take a well-deserved break and SMASH STUFF! A bus will take you to and from the rage room, and your event fee covers both the bus ride and rage room ticket. üìÜ Saturday, October 25th ‚è∞ 12:45 - 4:00 PM (Bus leaves 1 PM sharp!) üìç Wreck-It Room Canada Inc. (41 Lewis Rd, Unit A, Guelph, ON, N1H 1E9) üîó Sign-up link and payment due October 23rd: bit.ly/F25RageRoom ‚ÄºÔ∏è Please wear close toes shoes and comfortable clothing you can move in. You will be required to wear the PPE provided at the event. Each individual participant must also sign a waiver online before entering the rage room.

item.title: UWSC Street Lifting Competition

All experience levels are welcome, and prizes will be awarded to the winners! Sign-up link in bio ‚¨ÜÔ∏è

item.title: Big 6
item.description: We're excited to present Big 6! This is an in-session event for members on Saturday, October 25th! üéÉ üçÇ Whether it's to play more badminton, or to take a break from midterms üßê join in on some fun doubles games! ‚è∞ When: Saturday, October 25th, from 9:30 PM to 12:00 AM (session time!) üó∫Ô∏è Where: CIF gyms 1 and 2 *Note this event runs during session, there will be NO REGULAR SESSION ‚ÄºÔ∏è Registration Deadline: Friday, October 24th at 5:00 PM ‚åõ Spots are limited, so be sure to sign up ASAP! üì¢ Make sure to check out the logistics sheet through the QR code or listed below! You can also check out our discord for more frequent updates (link in bio) Hope everyone's midterms go well, and hope to see you on the courts! item.title: Future City Hackathon
item.description:
üåá Want to shape the future cities?
Join the Future City Hackathon sponsored by Waterloo Future Cities Institute and Eleven Labs! This competition challenges you to build AI tools and solutions for community impact.
You can win $250 CAD gift cards and, food and drinks will be provided on the Hackathon day! To add, there will be career talks with industry experts from Google, NVIDIA, and more!
üìÖ Dates: Wednesday October 22nd (Remote) Sunday October 26th, (In-Person) and Wednesday October 29th (Remote)
üìçLocation: Davis Centre (DC) 1350
To sign up and more information: Check the link in our bio!

item.title: UWHvZ Invitational
item.description: Join UWHvZ for this term‚Äôs Invitational game on Sunday October 26th from 9-5 for a day filled with adventure as we follow the journey of Lord of the Rings. Please join us in J.R. Coutts Engineering Lecture Hall (RCH 101) for registration from 9-945 as our first journey (mission) will begin promptly at 10! With the potentially unpredictable weather at this time of year, I recommend you bring a couple of layers and dress appropriately. If you have any questions feel free to ask away and they will be answered as quickly as possible. See you all soon!

item.title: Professional Networking
item.description: Welcome back from reading week! Here are the Week 8 events!‚ú® PROFESSIONAL NETWORKINGü§ùüí® Join us on our speed networking event, where you will get the opportunity to meet professional‚Äôs (professors and alumni) from different fields and industries! Upon registration, participants will be divided into groups where you will be paired with a professional. Every 3-5 minutes, your group will rotate to meet another professional. At the last hour, you will have the opportunity to talk/approach professionals who caught your interest. üìÜ Sunday, October 26th ‚è∞ 1:00 - 3:00 PM üìç E5-2004 üîó Sign-up link: bit.ly/F25ProfessionalNetworking

item.title: Catapult & Knot Tying Event
item.description:
ü™¢ Catapult and Knot Tying Social! ü™¢
Our third social of the term will be a knot tying workshop! Join us to for an afternoon of building catapults and launching water balloons!
üåü No membership required üåü Rope, Bamboo, and water balloons will be provided!

item.title: Divest Now
item.description:
UW DISCLOSED, AND IT‚ÄôS EVEN WORSE THAN WE THOUGHT
At more than $200 million invested, the University of Waterloo ranks among the worst university offenders of complicity in the genocide.
The students forced UW to drop Technion, and we will force the Board of Butchers to divest.
üö® TAKE ACTION NOW üö® ALL OUT OCTOBER 27th: DIVEST OR WE‚ÄôLL DISMANTLE
Join us on Monday, October 27th to demand divestment and a complete end to UWaterloo‚Äôs complicity in genocide and occupation.
The students demand divestment now, and we will not rest until UW divests every last dollar they have in companies aiding the Zionist entity, until UW ceases all support for genocide and occupation and until total liberation and return.

item.title: Halloween Showdown
item.description: Step right up and test your skills in a spooky showdown! Cats, bats, ghosts, and creepy crawlies wait for you to build a team in this singles point buy tournament. A spooky Cyndaquil plush will be awarded to the winner! Not confident on which teams are tricks or treats? Sample teams will be provided on our discord or on the day of if need be! The list of available Pokemon can be found on the second slide or on our Discord. The format will be nat dex singles with bans on megas and Z moves. Tera will also be allowed! 7 points are allowed for you to budget and build your team. Join our Discord or DM us on insta for more details.

item.title: Finding the Balance in Sustainable Menstruation
item.description:
üåç Sustainability goes beyond recycling bins; it's also about how we care for our bodies and communities.
Join us in exploring how sustainability, period poverty, and menstrual equity intersect in the next installment of the Menstrual Equity Series, "Finding the Balance in Sustainable Menstruation"!
üí°Hosted by Karen Farley (they/their) Environmental researcher and recent master's graduate, Karen's findings led to the creation of "Period Pin", an online map connecting menstruators to over 2,000 product locations across Canada.
**Registration link in bio
üìÜ Tuesday, November 4th! üìçOnline

item.title: Battle of the Jazz Bands
item.description: Its the event of the season! Come watch jazz bands from the University of Toronto, McMaster University and the University of Waterloo battle it out on the Hagey Hall Theater stage from 2:00-4:30 pm on November 9th. This will be our largest event yet and definitely the first of its kind. Bring everyone you know to attend this FREE concert.

item.title: Co-Op Workplace Simulation
item.description: Want to level up your co-op experience and impress your next employer? On October 22 join Velocity at the Co-op Workplace Simulation. This event is open to all students from any faculty or program. This is not just another workshop, it‚Äôs a dynamic simulation where you‚Äôll role-play real-world scenarios using AI tools. You‚Äôll step into the shoes of a co-op student working for an employer in any industry, spot a challenge, and learn how to bring your innovative solution to your employer - confidently and effectively. Register at the link in our bio!

item.title: Politics Without the Podium
item.description:
Bring a friend üëØ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è and join MP Bardish Chagger and MPP Catherine Fife for an evening of open conversation at the Bomber on Nov 13.
üí¨ Connect with your local representatives, ask questions, and share your thoughts in a casual, community-focused setting.
üëâ Link in bio to register!

item.title: GIS Day 2025
item.description: Are you interesting in sharing your experiences with GIS from personal research, class projects or professional settings? We are currently looking for enthusiasts interested in doing Lightning Talks for GIS Day! Lightning talks are 5-8 minute presentations that give you an opportunity to share your knowledge with your peers. GIS Day 2025 üïò: 2:30 to 4:30PM üìç: EV2-2002 Click the link in our LinkTree to register! Registration will close on October 20, 2025

item.title: STANK: Serve's Thanksgiving Annual N(v)olleyball Kompetition
item.description: ü•ß Prepare for a Feast of Fierce Volleyball! ü¶É As the leaves turn and the holiday spirit fills the air, it‚Äôs time for STANK: Serve‚Äôs Thanksgiving Annual N(v)olleyball Kompetition! Gather your team, bring your best plays, and get ready to serve up gratitude with spikes, digs, and fierce rallies. Let‚Äôs celebrate the season with some friendly competition and a full plate of fun! Event Details: üèê Date: Saturday, November 15th-16th (Overnight) ‚è∞ Time: 8pm to 8am üìç Location: PAC Main Gym + Small Gym üçÇ Team Sign-Up Form your crew of 6 to 9 players (only UWaterloo students with a valid athletics membership or alumni with a day pass) and choose your division: semi-competitive or competitive. Co-ed rules apply: all teams must have at least 2 female-identifying players on the court at all times. (Note: A female libero is required to serve for a middle.) ‚ö†Ô∏è NEW Semi-Comp Sign-Up Rules (Read Carefully!) To keep play balanced and fair this season: - Any male-identifying player rated Level 5 or of Level 5 ability must set or lib on a semi-comp team. - If you attended UW prior to the 5-level system (graduated before Fall 2023), the same rule applies if you were rated Level 4. - Spring levels are not included in this consideration. - If there‚Äôs any confusion, please reach out to an exec for clarification. - If your team has a Level 5 male player signed up for semi-comp, contact an exec to verify the validity of your team. - Players who are not evaluated this term may be removed from your team on the day of or asked to set/lib if necessary. üí∞ Pricing Regular (still fresh out of the coop): Register by Nov 3rd for $200 Both the form and payment must be completed by Nov 3rd @ 11:59pm. üìù How to Register Make your payment: https://warrior.uwaterloo.ca/Program/GetProgramDetails?courseId=e7072bd1-0754-4e99-9fbe-04a18228cfe1 Fill out the form: https://forms.office.com/r/twpLDkzmhD @everyone üèê Let‚Äôs spice up the season, rally together, and make this Thanksgiving one to remember!
